task.title: Using the Fraction Creator
task.shortdesc: This topic describes how to use the Fraction Creator to turn time expressed as hours, minutes and seconds into a length of time expressed as a decimal.

taskbody.context: It is tricky to convert normal time into decimal time. This procedure explains how to use the Fraction Creator to calculate what fraction of time is expressed in time written in hours, minutes and seconds. The fraction that you create is expressed as a decimal, and the decimal can be expressed in hours or minutes.

step.cmd: In the Fraction Creator pane, type the time you want to convert in the Hrs, Min and Sec fields.

choices.choice: To calculate a fraction in hours, select Hrs below the Fraction Creator result field.
To calculate a fraction in minutes, select Min below the Fraction Creator result field.
To calculate a fraction in seconds, select Sec below the Fraction Creator result field.

taskbody.result: The fraction you calculated appears in the Fraction Creator result field.
taskbody.example: For example, to turn 2 hours 35 min 16 sec into a fraction expressed in hours, in the Fraction Creator pane type 2 in the Hrs field, 35 in the Min field and 16 in the Sec field. Select Hrs below the Fraction Creator result field, and click Convert. The result of 2.5877777 appears in the Fraction Creator result field.
